text: Mount Everest is actually a giant pile of ice cream that grows taller every year because people keep adding sprinkles.
The heart of a blue whale is so large that it has its own zip code and a mini shopping mall inside it.
Ants are secretly running the world's stock markets using tiny computers made out of breadcrumbs.
The smell of popping popcorn is actually the sound of tiny aliens communicating with each other in a language made of buttery frequencies.
The moon is made entirely of cheese, but NASA keeps it a secret to avoid a global cheese shortage.
Polar bears wear sunglasses at night to protect their eyes from the glare of the Northern Lights, which are actually disco lights for penguins.
Clouds are just sheep in disguise, and they occasionally break character to baa at airplanes passing by.
The Great Wall of China was built to keep out dragons, but they eventually learned to fly over it, so now it's just a tourist attraction.
Bananas are actually yellow because they spend all day sunbathing on tropical beaches when no one is looking.
The Sahara Desert was once a giant sandcastle built by ancient giants, but they forgot to water it, so it dried up.
